intro: Klasea flavescens subsp. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered klasea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The subspecies is distinguished by its lighter floral coloration compared to other members of the species.
